newsitem.title: USA: Consumer protection heads to probe retailers-paper.
newsitem.headline: Consumer protection heads to probe retailers-paper.

text.p: A coalition of consumer protection officials plans to investigate if retailers besides Sears violated bankruptcy rights of customers, USA Today said on Monday.
The inquiry would be led by Massachusetts consumer protection officials who plan to invite the participation of other states in a national conference call Tuesday, the newspaper said.
George Weber, a consumer-protection chief in the Massachusetts Attorney General's office, was quoted in the newspaper as saying: "We intend to look at the practices of other organizations."
The U.S. Attorney for Massachusetts said on April 17 that his office filed a civil complaint against Sears to stop allegedly "fraudulent" debt collection activities.
